cons: commuting all the way to UBC

pros: Nice people, good working environment, opportunity to learn lots, flexible schedules
cons: Students receive minimum wage, not many opportunities to work elsewhere in the museum other than the shop

pros: Great company, loved working for them!
cons: No cons at all - had a great time there!

review_title: Excellent place to work as a student
pros: Beautiful environment, customers are usually open-minded visitors as they wouldn't have come in if they didn't like this stuff, learn lots about Aboriginal cultures. There are a variety of positions so you can work many positions or jump around.
cons: Nothing bad really, when you work there as a student you mostly associate with other students and your managers, who are really nice. As with any place, there are some nice people among the staff, and some not-so-nice, but you're not generally associating with the office staff so it's all good.

review_title: I worked in the gift shop and did tours as a student. Loved every minute of it.
job_title: Tour Guide and Gift Shop Assistant in Vancouver, BC
pros: Great coworkers, beautiful working environment, decent pay for a student job.
cons: Some of the permanent staff in the archaeology department can be unfriendly toward student workers.

pros: Meet lots of influential individuals, figure out what you want to do with your future, staff is respectful
cons: Sometimes need to deal with ignorant museum visitors, no salary boosts or bonuses or overtime
